anchor.p: Alexander asked (Sesonchosis), How many years will I live? He replied, It is good for a living man not to know when he is to die.
From there (Alexander) marched to the Amazons; and when he had reached them, he sent them a letter with the following contents:
We are marching on you. Meet us with joy; we do not come to do you ill, but to see your country and at the same time do you good.
Receiving Alexander's letter and reading it, (the leading Amazons) wrote Alexander this reply:
By our letter we shall make clear the nature of our country and of ourselves, who have a way of life to be reckoned with.
If we defeat the enemy … a terrible disgrace stays with them for all time; but if they defeat us, they will be in a situation of having defeated women.
Alexander read (the Amazons') letter and with a smile (a laugh) wrote them this reply:
If you want to live in your own land rather than try your luck in battle, cross your river and be seen by us.
On receiving and reading Alexander's letter, (the Amazons) … wrote him this reply:
We give you permission to come to us and see our country.
We accept allegiance to you, in your presence and in your absence: we have heard of your exceptional qualities and your bravery.
We have decided … to be subject to you as master.
After this exchange of letters, Alexander wrote his mother, Olympias, this account of his deeds:
The Amazons (are) women of exceptional height, much taller than other women, notable for their attractiveness and strength.
